newsitem.title: USA: Dow Jones index leaps 100 points to record high.
newsitem.headline: Dow Jones index leaps 100 points to record high.

text.p: The Dow Jones industrial average leaped more than 100 points to close at a record high Thursday as the June employment report confirmed the economy is slowing at a pace that would keep the Federal Reserve from raising interest rates.

Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow ended up 100.43 points, or 1.29 percent, at 7,895.81, eclipsing its June 20 record close of 7,796.51. In the broader market, advancing issues swamped declines 19-7 on volume of 378 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
The market closed early at 1 p.m. EDT/1700 GMT prior to Friday's Independence Day holiday.
